Alberta British Columbia Manitoba New Brunswick Newfoundland Nova Scotia Ontario Prince Edward Island Quebec St. Pierre at Miquelon Saskatchewan Yukon Your Blue Book Will Give You Complete Information On All Canadian Banks Following the American Bank information in the Blue Book is a complete list of Canadian Banks and their Branches. The Canadian Bank data is arranged in five columns which will give you any fact you want at a glance. The columns are in this order: POST OFFICE AND POPULATION NAME OF BANK — TRANSIT NUMBER UNDER NAME MANAGER OR AGENT PAID-UP CAPITAL, SURPLUS OR RESERVE FUNDS HEAD OFFICE AND CORRESPONDENTS Rand McNally Bankers Directory https://fraser.stlouisfed.org Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis THE BANKERS BLUE BOOK https://fraser.stlouisfed.org Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis Practical Knowledge for Key Employees Many of the country’s leading banks subscribe to Bankers Monthly for their officers, directors and key employees, because they have learned that only in this magazine can they find the actual current practices of other institutions on administration policies, operating and personnel methods, credits and collections, increasing deposits and selling services, adjustment of portfolios and director cooperation. During the next 12 months we plan to give our readers the following outstanding features, along with many other articles of interest: —a continuation of H. N. Stronck’s valuable series on Bank Management Controls. —a series of articles on “How to Get More Exact Credit Infor­ mation.” —At least three articles showing the benefits of closer correspondent bank relationships—and how they may be developed. —a continuation of the articles demonstrating the bank’s oppor­ tunities for increased profit by working with local dealers. —several experience stories each month on tested operation method and workroom technique. —a monthly article to help the officers in charge of purchasing and stock-keeping. —first information about new machines and other equipment. https://fraser.stlouisfed.org Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis —reports of successful advertising, public relations, and personnel programs. —two issues containing the semi-annual Buyers Guide for pur­ chasing officers. —all the bank changes of each month. Successful bankers are attentive readers of Bankers Monthly! If your officers and key employees are not already on our roster, write immediately for special group discounts.
